description: black and white photograph; portrait of man smoking cigar; severe expression, gazing toward PR; darkened background; text in right margin
inscription: right margin, in black ink: Weegee the famous (Arthur Felling) was a loud-mouthed, cigar-chomping New York bum- and he photographed like it, with a raw honesty and power that has never been matched. I photographed him in his one-room apartment, littered with piles of prints and photographic paraphernalia, a few months before he died, in 1968. He was alone, sad and often incoherent. But his pictures speak on, with Weegee\'s own true and honest voice.
title: Weegee the Famous (Arthur Felling), New York
